title: How to Clean Gossamer Fabric

steps.headline: Spot clean with a gentle vacuum cleaner.
steps.description:
Use the finest soft nozzle and avoid pulling against the fabric. Or, try using a very soft brush to remove dirt, fluff, etc. The brush bristles must have plenty of give and be extremely soft. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/6\/69\/Clean-Gossamer-Fabric-Step-1Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Clean-Gossamer-Fabric-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/6\/69\/Clean-Gossamer-Fabric-Step-1Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Clean-Gossamer-Fabric-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

License: Creative Commons<\/a>

\n<\/p><\/div>"}

steps.headline: Avoid washing.
steps.description: Gossamer is very fine and is not meant to be washed. Never machine wash an item made with gossamer; that will be the end of it. You might get away with a gentle spot clean using a damp cloth but do not rub or scrub and don't expect this to work–-the gossamer may fall apart instantly where it gets damp. If the item made from gossamer has sentimental value and is stained, take it to a professional fabric cleaner for advice.

steps.headline: Hang to dry the spot dampened gossamer fabric in a wind- or breeze-free environment.
steps.description: Drape over a supportive structure to air dry. This way, any wrinkles should fall out.

text:
Spot clean with a gentle vacuum cleaner. Use the finest soft nozzle and avoid pulling against the fabric. Or, try using a very soft brush to remove dirt, fluff, etc. The brush bristles must have plenty of give and be extremely soft. {"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/6\/69\/Clean-Gossamer-Fabric-Step-1Bullet1.jpg\/v4-460px-Clean-Gossamer-Fabric-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/thumb\/6\/69\/Clean-Gossamer-Fabric-Step-1Bullet1.jpg\/v4-760px-Clean-Gossamer-Fabric-Step-1Bullet1.jpg","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":345,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":570,"licensing":"

\n<\/p><\/div>"} Avoid washing. Gossamer is very fine and is not meant to be washed. Never machine wash an item made with gossamer; that will be the end of it. You might get away with a gentle spot clean using a damp cloth but do not rub or scrub and don't expect this to work–-the gossamer may fall apart instantly where it gets damp. If the item made from gossamer has sentimental value and is stained, take it to a professional fabric cleaner for advice. Hang to dry the spot dampened gossamer fabric in a wind- or breeze-free environment. Drape over a supportive structure to air dry. This way, any wrinkles should fall out.
